Alyona Abakumova,Danil Abramov,Leonid Aktubin,Anastasia Aleksandrova,Dmitriy Alshayev,Vasiliy Andreev,Pavel Andreev,Artem Astafyev,Tomiris Ahmetbekova,Alexander Akhmetshin,Ilya Bagrov,Aleksey Bedov,Alexander Belkevich,Igor Biryukov,Catherine Boledzuc,Alexander Borodin,Alexander Bikovsky,Igor Bichkov,Adriana Vaganova,Valeriya Veyze,Vinnie Denbro,Naila Gayadzinova,Alexander Gilts,Eugene Golovanov,Elena Grebenyuk,Maxim Gusev,Alexander Danilov,Artem Dashkov,Daria Deryabina,Nikita Doloman,Timothy Dopler,Irina Egorkina,Sergey Eliseev,Vladislav Zaitsev,Roman Zaharov,Elena Isanina,Dmitriy Istoshin,Olga Kaluzhnaya,Anton Kindin,Ivan Kolesnikov,Grigory Konkov,Ivan Korneev,Ksenya Korolyova,Sergey Kryakov,Catherine Kulikova,Sergey Kuptsov,Ilya Lavochnikov,Alexander Lyovshin,Constantine Lihachov,Sergey Lopatin,Natalia Luchnaya,Michael Medvedev,Marat Minishev,Yuri Mihaylov,Saveliy Nedorezov,Michael Nikiphorov,Maria Nicolskaya,Vladimir Nikolsky,Anastasia Novikova,Stanislav Noskov,Alyona Pimenova,Victoria Podgio,Vlad Ramadov,Veronika Rizhova,Alexander Ryabuha,Alexei Sausya,Alexei Saphonov,Christina Semyonova,Alina Sivtseva,Vera Simakina,Anastasia Sitkova,Oleg Skarukin,Roman Smorodov,Vladimir Solovyov,Max Stepanov,Ilya Strogonov,Eugene Syrkin,Yulia Tarasova,Nikita Tkachuk,Vitaliy Tokarev,Catherine Phedorova,Veronika Phomenko,Margarita Kholodkova,Sergey Cherenkov,Sofya Chernyak,Natalia Chistyakova,Gleb Chubarev,Alina Chudinova,Ivan Shashin,Alexandrа Stoll,Tatiana Rageva

Your gratitude will certainly affect the release of new games. Well, really, what is creativity without coffee?

JUST FOR
Signal incoming, please wait...
Something went wrong during purchasing. Please ensure you have an internet connected and valid logged in.
If you or Dr. Shepard encounter difficulties, you can always use the “Hint” menu. To do that, just touch the hint indicator with your finger when it lights up.

You opened up one of the gamebook’s three potential finales. In order to find out how else this story might have ended, use the control chapter bookmarks. Hint: The first finale opens up when Dr. Shepard goes for the generators, the other two – when you take a risk and send him to search for more data.

In the course of the quest you activate the control chapters. Touch the “Bookmark” icon and you'll be able to return to the available chapters in order to make a different choice or replay in case of Dr. Shepard’s death.

Gamebook action approximates real-time action. Sometimes the main character needs time to solve a task, cope with troubles or even sleep. Expectations should be realistic – time may vary from a minute to 6-8 hours. Be patient, and you’ll unravel all the mysteries of the Symbiont.

Try to find the medical kit or drag Ryo into the medical unit, then break out the door without delays or getting distracted by zombies. Then drag the scientist into the medical unit and block the door.
You can take Dr. Shepard through the lab via different routes. Each is unique in its own way.
In order to get to the elevator roof, you need to take a look around, find a knife, get the ceiling light off, close the cabin doors and continue with your work, then go on to the roof immediately.

Grab a piece of meat, make your way to the elevators or to the corridor. Call the zombies and retreat slowly. Then hide and wait, but not for too long. Tip: don't tease the zombies with your legs and don’t hide out for too long a time.

When you see a monster, order Dr. Shepard to leave, and when it wakes up, he should freeze and blind the monster with a flashlight. Then he has to run without stopping until he gets to the ventilation.
Fairway: left, straight, left, straight, right, right, left, right, left

The isolation ward requires complete silence. When it comes to talking to the guard, Shepard should either act extremely tough, stressing the fact that he’s from the clean-up unit, or keep total silence.
Fairway: left, left, straight, left, right, left, right.
Shepard needs to act decisively – capture the bag with explosives, threaten soldiers with the gun, but when the soldiers lose their patience, he shouldn’t go to the top levels.
The correct speed is 5 km/hour.
Correct password: 9785.
In order to create the serum you need the following ingredients: drug substance, inhibitors, Sample 23, water fixative G.
The action of the game is close to real time. Waitings can be from 5 minutes up to 12 hours. Be patient, and you will reveal all the secrets of Symbiont.
Some waitings can be skipped. Tap this button.
Thank you for viewing! Have a nice game!
This is not the end! To return to the last choice, tap this button.
If you or Dr. Shepard encounter difficulties, you can always use the “Tips & Tricks” menu. To do this, just tap this button.
[ Restart the game ]
“Doctor Shepard”
“Exit from the office I”
“Exit from the office II”
“Morgue or offices?”
“Near the medical unit I”
“Two news I”
“Near the medical unit II”
“Near elevators”
“Office’s elevator (doors)”
“Offices. Trap”
“Offices. Guard”
“Gateway. Monster”
“F-shaped maze”
“Elevator shaft”
“Choice of path”
“Infectious room”
“Dangerous materials. Monster”
“A fateful choice”
“Fire escape. Soldiers”
“Pills or explosive?”
“Choice of speed”
“Find №22 I”
“Find №22 II”
“Mix up all!”
“Voices”
“Good Shepard / Bad Shepard”
“Two news”
“Cocktail №23”
To listen.
[APPLICATION LAUNCH]
[NEW SIGNAL SOURCE DISCOVERED]
[INCOMING CALL]
[CONTACT ESTABLISHED]
Cut off communications!
I can hear you!
...Unbelievable! Oh God!
Hey! I picked up your signal! Respond!
Don’t keep silent, I’m begging you!
Is there anybody alive out there? Answer!
[You reset the device and uninstalled the program]
[Forgetting about short quest, you lived safely for the next two weeks without knowing about the mystery of “Shelter M-2”]
[And then the girl from next door, infected with the Z-01.21 virus, knocked at your door]
[You wanted to get friendly with her for a long time, so you opened the door without any delay]
[The first thing the “guest” did — she flung her arms around your neck]
[But not to give you a friendly hug at all]
[Her teeth were sharp, her bite was fast]
[Unlike your death]
Who are you?
I’m disconnecting!
Thank God! A living person. Incredible!
Please, listen to me and don’t switch the channel!
I’m in trouble! A major mess!
I need help!
[Helping people is not your style]
[You reset the device and uninstalled the program]
[After that your smartphone failed to switch on]
[Two weeks later you decided to buy a new one]
[On your way to the store your neighbor’s dog that was infected with the Z-01.21 virus, broke loose all of a sudden, and bit through your ankle]
[Despite the ache, you noticed the dog’s bright red eyes with a glimpse of the madness within]
[However, you avenged your pain soon]
[When you joined the zombie ranks, you ate the dog’s owner]
[He was vapid]
What do you mean by “used to be”?
Should I call for help?
My name’s Martin Shepard. Doctor Shepard, I'm a neuroscientist.
Actually... I used to be...
I just don’t have a job anymore and I think my days are numbered, too.
I'm ill... Infected with a deadly virus.
According to my observations and the last research results, I’ve got 36 hours left.
It's only 36 hours before...
It's simply terrible. Much worse than death itself, believe me.
Hey, no! Don’t you dare! No rescue team!
Do you hear me? Get this out of your head!
This can’t be done!
Never, ever!
Is this a prank?
What do have I to do with this?
It’s not easy to believe my story and it’s not easy for me to tell it either, but...
I should trust you. I just don’t have any other choice.
Apparently, there’s no one to trust but you either.
I hope you believe my story. Or I’m dead.
Well... listen.
I work... no — I WORKED at a governmental lab.
It was called “Shelter М-2”. It's a top-secret facility.
Don’t ask me where this place is. I don’t think you need to know this.
Shouldn’t gamble on your life like this.
You should know only one thing: this lab is very close to you. Too close!
You picked up my signal, didn't you?
Something happened in this lab. Something dreadful...
Go on with your story.
How can you flirt with death?
All of this is true! From the first word to the last.
But listen, whoever you are, I don’t have much time.
NONE OF US do.
No way!
Are those infected zombies?
Lives of millions are at stake! This concerns everyone!
There was a very dangerous virus leak in our lab about forty hours ago.
This virus is a secret research project for military purposes.
I'm a newbie in here and don’t know much, but that doesn’t matter now.
The main thing is that this warfare virus is special. Not just a new flu strain. It’s so much worse.
Not only does the virus strike human nerve centers, destroying them, but it makes the carriers infect others.
We call it aggressive infection.
The infected doesn’t just wait around to infect other people. He seeks the victim out ON HIS OWN!
It is... It’s the weapon of the devil! Even the atomic bomb is more humane than this.
There’s a lot of staff in our lab. Not all of them got infected at the very beginning.
But those who absorbed the Z-01.21 warfare virus went mad and began to hunt their colleagues down.
Only a few hours later the virus struck everybody...
I’m telling the truth! You should believe me!
Not only my life depends on this.
The future of the humanity may even be at stake!
The virus is extremely viable and it propagates rapidly.
When it gets inside a human body, it turns it into...
Why don't you call the rescuers?
Is that funny?!
Disgusting as it may seem, the word “zombie” suits best!
Now the whole lab is teeming with the living dead who are the carrying the most dangerous virus in the world!
I’m probably the last human in the “Shelter” who can still think.
Others have gone insane. They crave human blood and flesh.
This is how the virus influences the host organism: it excites the most primitive reflexes.
Fury, hunger, cruelty, desire to murder.
I’m lucky. I’d been hiding for a long time, trying to avoid danger.
Yet my time has come.
Right when I found the transmitter — and the hope for salvation — I lost my discretion...
And now, judging from the bite mark on my left hand, I'm doomed to become one of them within 36 hours.
The virus got into my bloodstream.
Heh-h... Do you know what fun is there in this ironic twist of fate?
I was infected by Dr. Johansson, a cute and shy young lady... at least in the previous life.
When I had just started to work here, she was the one who took care of me and introduced me to the staff.
It’s important when you start afresh in a new workplace.
And now... She’s turned into a bloodthirsty monster.
These are her tooth marks on my wrist. Just imagine...
I'm calling the police!
Why don't you call the rescuers?
Yes, right you are. There’s nothing funny.
It’s my nerves. Sorry.
In fact, it’s no fun for me at all: my hands are shaking, I’ve got goosebumps!
I’m just a scientist. I never thought I could get in such trouble.
What should I do?
It's terrible!
Listen: you cannot trust anybody! At all!
If you try to call the police or emergency services...
No good would come, believe me.
They have insiders everywhere.
When all this started, they decided to sweep everything under the rug.
They locked us up in here and left for dead. It’s called “witness elimination”.
If you call them... They are ruthless!
[Your call was received by emergency services. You were asked to hold on]
[That worried you a bit, but you obeyed]
[You were still waiting on the line even when the black helicopters started circling over your house]
[A few minutes later people wearing face masks broke in]
[Flung a sack on your head and kidnapped you]
[After a short but painful interrogation they took you in to brainwash]
[After losing your memory and much of your consciousness, you felt fine and dandy!]
[For a fortnight you lived without anxiety or fears]
[Later on, you saw the voracious zombies outside]
[“Oh, such lovely pets!” You cried and clapped your hands joyfully]
[Zombies didn’t reciprocate and rushed to the charge]
[Everything ended quickly and tragically, but you died with a smile on your face]
Go on...
It’s no worse than what’s happening here.
But thanks for your sympathy! I appreciate it.
Although I can’t guarantee that it will change my attitude towards you when I become a zombie.
Is the lab underground?
OK, well! I have little time, so I’ll speak fast.
According to their witness elimination program or, simply put, the “sweeping under the rug” strategy, they locked us in here and left us to die.
Electricity, communications and water are cut off; the outside doors are locked, the code red program has been activated.
When it started, we couldn’t get in touch with anyone. I don’t even know the reason for the accident.
Maybe it was a fatal accident, or maybe... I don't know.
However, now there are more important issues than the survival of a bunch of scientists.
Those who left us here thought that they had cut the lab completely off from the outside world.
But they were wrong. They’ve forgotten about something.
Not all of our generators were switched off! We still have the autonomous ones - the backup generators.
A repairman who serviced our equipment had managed to tell me about this before he died.
I have no reason not to believe him.
Basically, it means that very soon our system will open the locks for oxygen intake from the surface.
And then... Then the virus will get out to the surface through the air ducts! Out there! To the people!
I’m not sure how correct my calculations are. Maybe it will happen tomorrow, or maybe, as the technician claimed, — in a fortnight.
Either way, we can’t delay!
God... Only a fortnight before the Apocalypse!
I don’t think so!
All right! Let’s do it!
If the virus gets out — that’s when real hell will be let loose!
A lot of people are going to die, if anyone can even stop the epidemic at all.
I won’t lie: this may spell the end for the entire humanity!
A whole planet of zombies... A surprise for the aliens, if they decide to visit our Earth...
We shouldn’t allow this all-consuming death.
But I’m hurt and infected, I feel my head spinning. And it’s really difficult to think now: my thoughts are all jumbled.
That’s why you must help me.
Go on with your story.
Really?! Is that all that you’ve got out of it?
I really can’t believe how lucky I am to have such a sharp assistant!
Thank you so much! But...
Haven’t you been listening to me at all?
Please say that you aren’t a journalist and won’t try to find an entrance to our plague-infested dungeon.
[You’ve shut off your phone, and began to pack your bags]
[You didn't believe in saving humanity, and in a way were even happy about its impending destruction]
[That’s why you went to the airport in a good mood]
[“Road to nowhere...” you kept humming, as you bought a ticket to the most remote corner of the world]
[Such a pity that you’ve never been a tourist before]
[Then you’d know that tourists can be EVERYWHERE]
[And once, on a late moonless night]
[When you are sleeping peacefully in your cabin]
[Through your sleep you’ll hear cheerful rumbling and growling, “FOOD!!!”]
[“Where?” you’ll ask sleepily. And when the teeth of the walking dead dig into your flesh, you’ll understand that you are the food]
May I call a friend?
Where are you now?
Thanks! Thank you!
At least now I have some hope.
I’m ready to jump with joy!
We'll definitely manage everything! I’m sure about that.
But I have to warn you: I don’t know the entire lab so well. It’s a classified facility, so I didn’t have access to all levels.
And there are so many of them. Floors of laboratories, botanical research facilities, animal stalls, technical levels...
We weren’t allowed to move outside our level, that’s why we are on an equal footing.
I don’t know anything about the local “geography” either. I'm just a neuroscientist.
I was working in the lab in peace and quiet, studying tissue samples and looking into the microscope.
I didn’t even conduct experiments, usually working with someone else’s reports.
Besides, it’s so dark in here now. Emergency lights work, but not everywhere.
And the corridors are full of bloodthirsty monsters. It's scary.
So... We'll have to act at our own risk.
I don't use Facebook...
Where are you now?
Why don’t you just post it on Facebook, huh?
So that everyone knows about us for sure.
Stop talking, let’s just save humanity!
I thought I was already helping you...
I’m sorry. Where are you now?
Too bad, or you would have liked my “Symbiont” page...
Anyway, your comment is very valuable.
Now I know that you’re an extraordinary person, who doesn’t use social networks in the 21st century. Well done!
But maybe you’ll already start helping in some other way? Some real way?
Are you frightened?
Search the office.
So... I’m in Professor O’Brien’s office now.
He was a nice old man. My chief. And he was nice as a chief, too.
It's a pity... He was one of the first to die, too old to run away from zombies.
So sad... It was a pleasure to work under his leadership... But I think there’s no time for sorrow.
We have bigger fish to fry — we need to save humanity!
It’s so strange... I felt like a character out of a comic strip or a text adventure game when I said that...
Well! OK! I need to get my thoughts in order!
Well, I’m in Professor O'Brien's office. Doctor Johansson forced me inside.
I can still hear her screaming in the corridor...
Stay low. She might go away.
Search the office.
No, what are you saying? She's got the voice of an angel!
I could listen to it forever!
And you will, in about two weeks, if you don’t give me some better advice!
Are you sure? Are you absolutely sure? I'll try...
You'll have to wait now, OK?
I’ll stop speaking for a second.
So the infected could go their own way.
That's it!
Perfect! Search the office.
Go out into the corridor.
I thought I should be the one to ask this question...
It’s very hard for me to make decisions right now.
My heart’s beating faster, I feel dizzy.
I can almost feel the virus spreading through my body.
This is... this is horrible.
But I guess you can search the office first. How do you like it?
Then search the office…
Trust me!
Hmm... Just like that? Right into the zombies’ claws? It’s so dark in here, I just can’t see anything!
You don't work for a state corporation or special services, do you?
I think you’re trying to kill me.
[Shepard doubted the adequacy of your advice]
[Then he finally went out]
[Zombies roared with triumph in the corridor, you could hear the sound of fighting and tortured screaming]
[“I guess,” you thought, “my pen-pal died.”]
[“I need to get out before it starts!”]
[And you began to pack quickly]
[Your savings were enough for the essentials and a ticket to the South Pole]
[You spent the rest of your life in the middle of the ice desert, training penguins]
[You were pretty good at it, dreaming sadly of setting up your own circus]
Look into the desk drawers.
You have my sympathy.
Yeah, right you are. I’ll do that.
It’s dark in the office. I can hardly see anything.
I’m flipping the switch... Nothing happens. Emergency lighting is off.
It’s a real mess here: everything is broken, a heap of papers on the floor, the desk is upside down...
It seems that this is where the professor met his unpleasant fate. Apparently, there was a brief, but violent fight here.
I’m lucky that the professor went for a walk after he’s been turned into a zombie.
Or he would have distracted us a lot, wouldn't he?
To be honest, it’s a bit scary to wander in the dark! My heart is pounding, my back is drenched.
I imagine the walking dead in every corner, just waiting to...
Yecch! How did I get into this...
So... The search brought the following results: there’s a cabinet with papers (which are now on the floor), a desk and...
Ouch! And a chair! I bumped very hard against it just now!
OK, come on.
Thanks, but I’m much more worried about the bite on my left arm.
The skin around it is becoming hot and itchy. The virus never sleeps.
We must hurry up. Do you mind if I look into the desk drawers?
What do zombies look like?
Search the desk!
I’ll have to turn it over then, it’s upside down.
It’s a tough task with only one arm. But I'll try...
Well... Hey-ho, bear a hand!
Ugh... still trying... so heavy! Oh!
Phew... I wish I’d listened to my wife and did sports. My desk job certainly doesn’t help to stay fit...
One thing is comforting: when I become a zombie, I’ll get stronger at once. I saw fragile Anita Johansson throw a lab cabinet with one hand.
Or is it a cold comfort, what do you think?
Look into the desk drawers.
Well... it’s pretty disgusting, to be honest.
Doctor Johansson... She was a pretty blonde. She looked really good for 30.
Now it’s an aggressive creature in torn dirty bloodstained clothes.
She has brown skin and crazy goggling yellow eyes with red irises.
Her hair, once golden, is disheveled like that of a mad scientist, and she is drooling green saliva everywhere.
I’ll cross my fingers.
Well, yeah, “ew”. Did I ever say that zombies were anything like a fresh fruit basket?
You asked me yourself. And I have no one else to tell.
Do you think I’m all comfy here? Nope, not really.
I’m actually a peaceful scientist, not Chris Redfield or some other zombie killer.
I’m very, very scared here...
Well... Excuse me. Let me see what the professor had in his drawers.
Hopefully, there’s antiviral serum, an armored suit and a six-barreled gun.
Or at the very least an М-16.
All right, what do we have here? In our nice little drawers...
I hope I find something useful...
What’s “Serum 22”?
What else is in the room?
What’s written on it? Hmm. Wait a minute... I'm reading:
“The virus has proven its top quality during the trials.”
“It is extremely viable even in exceedingly low or high-temperature environments.”
“The virus is stable, and the infected individual lives for about 36 hours before it transforms.”
“During this entire period the individual experiences cellular alterations as the carrier's system undergoes a mutation.”
“After the transformation the carrier can last for 70 days without sustenance.”
“The only threat to the virus is Serum 22,” That's all...
I wish I hadn’t read this! It’s way too depressing.
How are you?
Get out of the room.
Seems that there’s nothing else to take.
I’d like to find something useful, but...
There’s nothing else.
What else is there in the room?
You have to get out!
Honestly... I don't know. Our work was divided into blocks, everyone did their part.
I was working on the model of a central nervous system infected by the virus.
I tried to reduce the damaging effects of the virus somehow and allow the infected to remain conscious.
None of my experiments succeeded. The virus is dreadful.
The way it affects a person resembles a nuclear explosion...
Some things are left over, but they can’t be used anymore.
Do you think... You think it’s some kind of an antiviral serum?
Hmm... my hope is shining like a diamond in the sun, but my mind tells me there’s no salvation.
I’ve seen the virus in action with my own eyes...
There’s no escape...
Let’s do it then!
As a man who had his wrist bitten by a former colleague, who turned into a zombie.
I’m shivering, feverish, scared and thirsty.
These are the first symptoms of the virus in action. As a neuroscientist, I can state with full responsibility...
It’s all over!
But I can see what you're driving at. And you’re right, once again. Yes, we should move on.
Come outside!
Stay low. Let them go away.
The door is locked from the inside. Zombies can’t force their way in. But...
I can hear them still waiting for me outside.
The dead really have no reason to hurry...
Oh, I sound like a philosopher. Hmm... maybe I’ll become the first zombie-philosopher...
Okay, keep it low and sit tight.
Don’t chicken out!
What, are you kidding?
Did you really just tell me to attack the zombies? Me? I’m unarmed!
Hmm... I can't shake the feeling...
I have no idea how you managed to reach me. Lord knows, I was glad at first, but now...
Now I’m full of doubt. You definitely don't work for the government, do you?
I think you’re trying to kill me.
Enough talking! Come outside.
Stay low.
Should I cry “Banzai!” or “Allah Akbar!” when I throw myself at the zombies?
I feel like that would go best with this suicide mission.

Come back to the basement.
Open it!
I'm in the corridor! It's so gloomy over here.
Well, I've got a slight hitch.
There is a door around the corner.
The door board says “Authorized staff only”.
Does this place fit the description of a fire escape?
I don’t think so.
Still, should I open up or come back?
I'm standing at the door with the sign...well, I've already read what is written there.
The warehouse door is locked! But...
Dear TV audience, ladies and gentlemen! Bingo! We've got the keys!
“Voila” as the French say!
Now it’s time for the keys to jingle for a while...
Just a second... no, just a minute... Where on earth is the key to the basement?! Aha!
Did you change your mind? Should I go to the warehouse?
You’re so fickle.
All right, let's go with your gut. Maybe you're right.
Did you change your mind? Should I go to the staircase?
You’re so fickle.
All right, let's go with your gut. Maybe you're right.

To the left.

Hooray, people!
I'm coming in. First, I’m opening the door slightly, then listening...
Everything’s quiet in there. Well, now I’m definitely coming in.
Hey, Houston, can you read me? Over!
I’m in, it’s so dark and quiet here.
Well. This place is huge, I could feel it right from the start.
And for some reason I don’t want to go straight to its center right now.
I’ll walk along the walls first, alright.
The question is whether I should go right or left?
Skip it: Go to the warehouse.
Try to break the door down.
That’s strange...

Turned the key in the keyhole freely, all the clicks rang out, but...
The doorknob works, but not the door itself.
Seems like it’s locked from the inside.
Perfect, I like that. I’m starting to move.
I’m walking along the wall, with my back against it.
Perfect, I like that. I’m starting to move.
I’m walking along the wall, with my back against it.

Go to the warehouse.
Well... not a bad idea.

All right, I'll give a vocal master class now...
Hey! Halloo! Is anybody alive?! Not the living dead, but the really alive! Completely alive, I’d call it!

Silence. No response.

Forget it. Sorry, you surely give decent advice, but sometimes...
Well, just believe me: I screamed so loudly that even zombies could hear me on the other floors.
We are at a dead end here. The door is locked from within!
So I propose going to the warehouse. Maybe we’ll find something useful in there.

I'm standing at the door with the sign...well, I've already read what is written there.
The warehouse door is locked! But...
That’s not a problem for us, right? I’m opening it.
Move along.
The flashlight beam is highlighting some containers. Lots of them.
These huge crates are taller than a man.
Should I approach and examine them or keep on moving?
What’s there in the other crates?
Move along.
Well... What do we have here?
Hmm... the cargo has a strange label on it: “ZN-13-72”
What could it mean?
I followed your advice, I swear, and walked around this warehouse...
It’s strange... It's very strange. This warehouse is not much of a normal warehouse.
You see, as if everything was piled up in case of. Hmm... as if people wanted to move out quickly or something.
You know... damn, I can’t explain it. Just had this strange feeling.
These cargo containers by the wall have a strange label on them: “ZN-13-72”.
What could it mean?
I’m continuing my examination.
But frankly, it seems pretty pointless.
The same labels are on all of the crates, only the numbers are different.
Aha, there’s the biohazard sign.
These containers probably contain materials required for research.
OK, whatever you say.
I’m still inspecting the space. But I haven't noticed anything yet.
The flashlight beam doesn’t allow to see much, but what I can see doesn’t inspire optimism.
I’m about to walk around this warehouse...
Wanna talk?
Search for the exit from the basement.
Well, seems I've walked around the entire place.
And here’s my resume:
Our warehouse is filled to the brim with these containers.
And there are also things as trivial as dewars of liquid nitrogen and other useful lab stuff.
But there are some pretty good things too. For instance, I’m still alive and well (not counting the virus in my blood).
I want you to know — it’s all because of you.
I don’t know what your profession is, but you need to quit it.
Quit and start up your own rescue business. You’re damn good at helping people in unusual troubles.
You know, I’m standing here, in the middle of nowhere, alone in the dark, speaking to you, and it feels like I’m slowly going insane.
For example, the darkness doesn’t spook me like it did before. Maybe I got used to it, or maybe your support is helping me.
You can be sure of that, I’m not exaggerating.
In my predicament, communicating with you is really a gift from above.
Especially with someone who can listen so skillfully, mumbling only “to the right”, “to the left”...
With your “talkativeness,” you would make a hideous partner on a desert island, but here and now you’re just perfect!
That's it. I’m done.
Everything's all right.
What were you working on?
It's a very tempting offer.
I’d like to agree and chat immediately.
Though I've never thought of myself as talkative.
Return to the stairs.
Search for the exit from the warehouse.
Maybe you should get some more rest?
Should I search for the exit or try to go to another place?
Wanna talk?
Search for the exit from the warehouse.

In that case we’re thinking along the same lines. I agree, that’s because of the extreme situation.

I'll get some rest, because my feet are crying, and tell you what I was working on, okay?
Enough talking! Look for a way out.
No, that’s good.
Wait, let me get seated as comfortably as possible on the floor...
О-о-о... my feet... this is so good...
So, what was I saying? My job...
You see, of course, I knew that they weren’t dealing with peaceful matters in the top-secret laboratories.
I’m a grown man, although I like playing video games in my free time.
But first of all, I couldn’t miss this chance and refuse.
What alternatives did I have? And this could be a once-in-a-lifetime chance.
Secondly, it was great to think that most scientific advances were achieved in such labs.
I can think of dozens of examples. Some of them even involved experiments on humans...
Yeah, human history is disgusting.
When you read about everything that people had done to themselves, you almost want to scream: “People! What’s wrong with you?!”
Who can start a war and bring down entire nations for one woman, even the most beautiful one of all? Huh?
And the names of these fools stay in history, while so many people were just killed off on the foolish whim of a useless kinglet!
Just think, they had families, dreams of the future, they had...
So I went to work here, cherishing the hope that someday I would be able to do something decent.
Invent a cheap and effective cure for cancer, or the pill that would prolong human life by a hundred years or so...
Or at least a remedy for greed and envy, so that people could love themselves and those around them, and live happily...
Foolish, isn’t it? Naive?
Everything is possible.
Get up, look for a way out.
Really? If you think so, you’re a good man...
I’m very lucky with this...
But so far, I haven’t had the time to invent anything. Unfortunately.
I’d only worked here for a few weeks, didn’t even have the time to realize what this research was about, when...
When all this happened.
Everything is dreadful, like a nightmare. I still can’t believe it.
Zombies, soldiers, intrigues...
Maybe I will never invent anything useful now.
Maybe this virus will finish me off, and that’s how the story will end.
I wouldn’t want such an ending.
I like to believe in happy endings. I like to believe in people...
By the way, about the people.
Tell me, do you believe in that guard’s words? The one who said that scientists released this deadly virus?
Yes, are right on that, one hundred percent right.
Nothing can be said for sure. That disturbs me.
I hope it doesn’t get worse...
Well, it seems like I have refreshed a bit. And, as you know, time is short.
Let me try to find an exit from the warehouse, ok?
Come back to the warehouse.
OK. I'm coming back.
Well, I'm in the corridor. It's so gloomy in here.
I've got a slight hitch over here.
There is a door around the corner.
The door board says “Authorized staff only”.

I don’t think so.

I have to find a way out.
It's me, over!

Hey, pal! Yoo-hoo!
Answer, even if you are only a product of my inflamed imagination

This basement gives me the chills...

Oh, you’re so touchy. Okay, never mind.
It’s only a joke. Sorry.
Is that all? Are we through? Peace?
Nice, 'cause I've got something to tell you about.
With the interesting stuff.
With the ‘not so good’ stuff.
Anyway, I took a thorough look around here, like you wanted me to.
But don't expect to hear anything good. There's nothing good. Instead I’ve got something interesting and not so good.

What else is there in the docs?
Ah, we'll start with an interesting stuff, shall we? You’re curious, aren’t you?!
I like that. It’s a sign of an enquiring mind.
Okay, I’ll tell you everything.
I stumbled over something and fell while searching the warehouse.
It's a miracle that I didn't break the flashlight. It could be fun to be alone in the dark.
Put simply, I was lying on the floor; it was filthy and sticky, yuck! Well, I’m lying on the floor and suddenly I see...
The flashlight beam highlighted something white under a container.
And I poked it with my fingers. It turned out these were documents: a consignment note to transport goods through the lab.
Do you know what’s in it?
“Serum-22” is mentioned here, besides the rest of the stuff!
Yeah, yeah! That’s the mysterious “Serum-22”, which can block the virus.
The consignment says that the only fully prepared batch of “Serum-22” was sent to the management floor. That’s A4.
Do you understand? Major Jackson’s portable computer with all the data is somewhere there, too!
We need to visit the A4 level! It’s a must!
Be patient.
And what’s the interesting news?
I knew that you were a latent pessimist. You're drawn to all these “not so good” things.
That must be precisely why my transmitter’s signal found you.
Okay, get to the point.
The not so good news is the fact that I found a ventilation grid.
It’s sort of the way out when all the doors are locked and sort of awful at the same time, right?
Awful, isn't it?
Ventilation grids are for Gordon Freeman. He’s an expert on this. But I don’t like them.
It’s dusty, dark and somber in there.
Besides I’m prone to fits of claustrophobia.
You’re just a model of compassion, aren’t you?
Is this the vengeance for “you’re a product of my imagination”?
That was a joke, pal...
Ah, okay. Let me tell you about my second finding.

Ah, never mind, I’m going into this black hole of all horror movies — to the ventilation...
Don't think ill of me!
That’s not funny.
Did you make it?
Alpha, this is Omega. Can you read me? Over!
Agent “Neuroscientist” is calling the base!
Are you in position already?
Stop it, joker.
I just remembered that absurd humor is a good defense mechanism in stressful situations. I’m mastering it now.
Judging by your reaction, I’m haven’t mastered it yet, right?
Tell me the truth, I’m begging you!
Tell me if you want my heart to break once and forever, because then it’ll no longer feel any pain...
So what's in the room, you top-dog strategist?
Get off and take a look around.
It’s hard to say whether I’ve reached the final destination or not...
I knocked the ventilation casing out with my foot and now I’m looking around this weird place from a two-yard height.
Seems like it’s the main part. I can see a short air lock module, apparently, there is a door behind it, which is locked from the other side and which didn’t give in.
Well, let’s come back to the main part of the room...
I’m learning fast. And this fact I had to find out on my own just now.
The thing is that I found the escape routes first, without starting to look around the place or searching for something.
Aha, the path to salvation! I'm like a hardcore zombie hunter.
So, I found another ventilation window using the flashlight beam.
This window is very low, I can almost reach it standing on the floor.
It won’t be difficult to get to it.
OK, I’ll be dumb as an oyster, if you want to.
But you must admit that we should have tried to take the heat off, right?
Don't laugh, you pain in the ass!
I’d like to watch you under these circumstances.
Or you would act differently? Wouldn't you?
Oh yeah, my compliments to you then, Mr. Perfect!
Well, I’m going downstairs and I’ll search the room very carefully.
What's up?
Stay focused.
...I nearly broke my back on my way down!
Well, I’m all in the room now!
I’m starting to search the room and...
It looks like... like... Oh God! OH MY GOD!
It’s hard to speak... I’m out of breath...
My Goodness... I have never seen anything like this...
This terror almost caused me to have a heart attack ...
It was... It was awful!
Wait, I have to pluck up my courage... Just a minute...
Yes... Yes, right you are...excuse me...
Wait, wait, just one m-minute, p-please...
What is it?
Are you OK?
I climbed down in a place that looks like a warehouse...
I can see the old white gowns, bags with used consumables and other medical waste.
Disinfection jars, surgical steel...
And then... Oh, then I went behind the screen and in the red light of the emergency lamp...
Oh God! I came back there and now I’m looking at this mess again!
There’s a surgical table right here, it looks like an autopsy table.
Everything is reddish-brown from the dried blood, it stinks like hell! There are dead flies, larvae in blood all over the place...
It looks like a team of necromancer demons did some work here!
But the worst is on the floor, right next to the table...
Black and white tiles are entirely drenched in blood, and there is...
It’s not a human arm! I can guarantee it!!!
First of all, it’s three-fingered, with blackened skin that resembles coarse scales.
I can also say that this arm has a non-human muscle and tendon structure.
Oh my God...
I don’t know what this creature is.
An alien?! A mutant?! Or maybe it’s just a plastic dummy!
Nobody can ever make me touch this... this...
Wait a minute, please, I just need a minute to take a breath and I...
It seems...
I’m going to puke now!
No!!! Definitely not!
I’m out of gear!
My head is spinning, and I think I’m going nuts!
As if I landed in Zone 51!
Are you feeling any better?
Hey... buddy, are you there??
I feel really unwell...
I hadn’t felt like this since medical school times...
I puked because of all this bloody madness... And more than once.
Disgusting? You can’t see what I’m seeing in this very room!
That is really disgusting!
It’s downright disgusting! One hundred percent disgusting!
I wish I could never see it again or remember it...
A little bit. Yes.
I’m still dizzy, but it's better already.
Thank you for asking.
I don't know...
Keep on searching.
Well, I recovered my breath somewhat.
Now I can analyze the situation more or less clearly again.
I noticed a map of vent channels on the wall.
This scheme resembles a question mark, this is the Greek phi, but it consists entirely of squares. This ventilation is like a huge tricky maze.
I also noticed the latched handcuffs on the floor. They are all drenched in blood.
It looks like some creature was handcuffed, but the irons didn't help.
The operating room is a mess, all the jars are broken, the tools are all over the floor.
I can’t even call this a smell. It’s a crazy mixture of blood, rotting flesh and medicine.
Tell me who could do something like this in our lab?!
What creature was held here?! Who was experimenting with it? What for purpose?
And the most important — what happened next? Where did this one-armed beast go?
Yes... And I don't know either...
I have no clue. It's atrocious!
Leave that place.
Come up and check it out!
It’s so hard for me to go on searching, but I’ll overcome myself.
I understand that the exact same mess may start upstairs, if I fail to prevent it.
I just can’t let this happen!
Never mind my life! We ought to stop it!
We have to save people!
OK, I'll keep searching...
Well, I’ve rummaged through everything here.
I’m moving to the airlock door.
Broken glass is crunching under my feet...
There’s a numeric lock in the airlock door panel and a key card slot, but there is no electricity now, and the lock isn’t working...
The door opens on its own...
I don’t really want to say it, but I noticed some deep scratches on the door.
They are very deep! It looks like they have been hacked with a sword, not claws. But what made me think of claws?
Can it be that a scientist brought a sword into a top-secret lab and cut the door up? Is that possible?
OK, don’t answer, I can tell that it’s an absurd idea...
Don’t abandon me, OK? I need your help right now like I never did before!
Well, I’m leaving the airlock chamber and...
God Almighty!
Now... now I understand WHO locked the door from this side.
Oh my, it’s so hard to talk about this...
It was a man in his forties. He is still lying next to the door, and it’s all stained with his blood.
Something has torn his back apart all the way through to his guts!
No, I won’t tell you any details just to spare your nerves.
So I’m just never going to sleep again...
Some beast, some monster has just pried a man open as if he was a can of sardines!
And ate all his organs out...
No!!! We need to stop! There's no need for you to see that!
At least one of us must think clearly and stay cool.
I’m looking to the side. And do you know what I was thinking about?
I thought that this martyr, who sentenced himself to death and locked himself in here with this monster, wanted to save others.
I also thought that if this door is locked, it means that the monster...
I... I... I see it!
It’s sitting under the table... still and wrapped in some leather cocoon-like thing...
May it be dead?
You are dead right!
I’ve got to take to my heels!
I’ll retreat to the vent slowly and...
OK, leave.
That's right: examine it.
Sorry... WHAT?!
I’m not sure that I heard you correctly.
You advised me to go and EXAMINE IT?!
Tell me that I didn’t hear you right!
Am I dreaming? Oh, God...
I... Well, I'm coming closer...
Just a few steps in that direction, but I’m not enjoying this at all.
Here, I took a little step forward. Happy?
[Shepard had hardly finished his phrase when the monster let out a nasty sound]
[As if some old shriveled tarp was unwrapped]
[You guessed that the creature has crept out of its cocoon]
[The next second Shepard's scream made it clear that it’s alive and very hungry]
[The fight was short and futile]
[Shepard’s scream sank in the ocean of the monster’s triumphant roar]
[And it was the first roar of the damn creature that heralded the beginning of apocalypse]
[Shepard's voice stopped suddenly]
[You heard an odd sound]
[It reminded you of the sound of unwrapping old shriveled tarp]
[And then a fierce squeak rasped on your nerves]
The beast! It's alive!
It’s crept out of its cocoon and is staring at me!
It has tiny black eyes with so much hatred in them...
I... I can’t move!
It's appalling!
Like a huge leathery spider!
Back down, slowly.
I’m standing still... not breathing... praying...
It’s just standing and... staring at me...
IT’S GOT HUGE FANGS!!!
I’ve never seen anything like them before...
Should I... Should I just stand like this or make a run for it already?
[Shepard took off like a bat out of hell]
[But this triggered the monster's hunting instinct and it rushed to attack]
[Shepard was merely able to reach the air lock]
[He wanted to shut the door]
[But it was too late]
[His death cry was horrifying]
[Such a cry can make you ten years older in a wink]

Right you are, no need to take needless risks.

I found a utility room. The door was locked but it’s not a problem for me anymore, isn't it?
I’m like Aladdin who can enter any place he wants.

...Is it failing or what? Oh! Are you there?

I'm on the line!

Hey! Has the transmitter fizzled out?

Great! Super!
I was afraid I’d be left without your useful advice.
Now there's no need to worry. Everything’s fine.
By the way, before you ask, something has happened here.
What was that?
Are you wounded?
I was on top of the elevator when something exploded up there, around A1 or A2 level.
Do you know what I mean? Something just blew up at full blast! It was awesome!
I nearly died!
I've no idea... honestly!
It came like a thunderbolt from a clear sky.
Seemingly negative...
There’s some serious ringing in my ears. I guess it means the nerve cells in my auditory system are dying.
When this ringing subsides, I'll be unable to hear anything within this frequency.
Yet, basically, I’m alive and unharmed. And that’s kind of weird.
Where are you now?
How is your virus?
We certainly didn’t have such powerful explosives in our lab.
I’m practically sure about that.
Well, I didn’t inspect the whole lab, I hadn’t been to some of the levels, but...
I would certainly know if any...
You know it couldn’t go unnoticed.
Army men, strange boxes, rumors and rumors.
Gossip is just like rust. It’s everywhere.
And if someone brings explosives or a weapon to the lab - we would know that.
What a mess!
Can you just get out of there?
I'm still there, in the elevator shaft. Though the situation has changed here.
When something detonated upstairs, I sprang back instinctively.
And it was incredibly lucky, since I went back-first into little niche in the shaft.
It turned out to be a small tunnel, used for power cables and a ladder.
And the elevators... They are filled with huge concrete slabs.
Not that much. I’m not happy with it at all.
Maybe it’s all about my suspicions, but I guess that I’m not gonna watch the last season of “Game of thrones”.
It may even be for the best. Nobody knows what will cross the producers’ minds.
Well, the virus never sleeps, it’s still doing its dirty work.
So, while we still have some time, I suggest we continue our humanity-saving mission.
Damn, that’s as earnest as it gets!
I already regret getting a job here.
Although I used to think it was such a great chance...
You can work for the benefit of your country and do your own research at the same time.
I dreamt of inventing some anti-aging pills or at least a cure for cancer.
But it turned out to be much more prosaic.
Well, let’s get to the point.
Wanna talk?
Good luck!
Frankly speaking, I only have one way to go - upstairs.
And this is the good news. Since it’s on the way.
The technical floor is up on top, the generators we need are still working there.
But I can’t see the entire elevator shaft. There is so much debris around here - big and small pieces.
I have to be very careful scrambling through there.
So, wish me good luck.
Tell me about yourself.
I changed my mind: let’s move!
Well...Actually, I don't mind, but it’s not going to be a great conversation.
You will be listening, and I will be pouring my heart out.
I’ll feel much better, but do you really want this?
I’ll turn off the transmitter for a while ‘cause I need to concentrate right now, okay?
Just for a few minutes.
I’ll connect with you as soon as the situation changes, okey-dokey?
Thanks for staying with me during all this time.
Talk to you later!
About me... this question has always made me feel lost...
What can I say about myself?
I’ve got dark-hair. Nearly 6 feet tall, 170 pounds. I like classic rock and...
I’ve got a wife and a little daughter...
Her name is Lisa... I mean my daughter's name. My wife is Debra.
It’s only been two years since we got married. And only half a year since Lisa was born...
I was so happy then, so... Eh...
And now, most likely, I’ll never be hold her in my arms.
My rosy-cheeked baby...
Sorry, pal, but I can’t...
These feelings are taking my breath away.
I think of my family and fall into despair. It's enough to make you moan and groan.
I remember all the little things at once when I’m thinking of my family: smells, touches, actions. Our life is made of them.
And my daughter's smile when she just wakes up and sees you next to her...
This smile is so pure, and her eyes are full of sincere joy!
And the scent of the hair of your beloved, when she is making breakfast for you, and you’re hugging her from behind...
Trivial things, but there are so many feelings in them...
You know, saying “I love you” a thousand times may not mean anything at all.
But if you do everything for someone you love, every day...
“Sweetheart, let me wash the dishes instead of you”. Or “Honey, I’ll make your favorite omelet for breakfast, if you want...”
One action is worth millions of words! And that’s wonderful. But...
But to think about my old life now, knowing that I’ll never return to them, is real torment.
Enough talking, let’s move on, okay?
I’ll have enough time to take a stroll down memory lane before I die.
These will probably be the best moments of my life — at least in my thoughts I’ll be with those I love.
All right, pal, thanks so much for your support, but I’m climbing up.
I need to keep myself busy or... or I'll fly off the handle.
My nerves are not made of steel.
What's up?
Which cue?
Hey buddy! It's me, over!
Mind you, I didn’t say I was there already. Only that I’m back on the air.
Did you get the cue?
Anyway, I flew off my hinges.
It turns out that a wall fragment had destroyed the stairs.
Now I’m standing at the very edge of it. And I’m happy that this fragment hit the stairs and a power cable instead of me.
Otherwise, there would be an unappealing dish called “Minced neuroscientist.”
Well. What was I talking about? Oh, yeah! About the route...
So, the door had been broken down and now it’s somehow hanging in the middle of the elevator shaft.
There’s only one way left. I can try to jump to the next floor.
This isn’t the A4 level that we need, and not even A1 where the engine room is, but only A8.
If I can make it and hold on to the edge I could search for another way to A8.
Nobody’s asking for your advice now. Anyway, it is only one way. I just wanted you to know that.
If you hear me screaming “Aaaa!” and then something like a “Bang” in the end, it will mean that I died like a hero.
You know what I'm talking about?

А-А-А-А-А!!!
I'm happy for you

I jumped like Superman! No! Like Batman!
I should have become an acrobat, not a scientist!
Are you really glad? You sound very sarcastic.

Enough talking!

I want to say that it was triggered by that explosion I still know nothing about.
There's light, but it's so faint. These are emergency lights.
Oh, I can see the fire emergency evacuation plan in the flashlight beam. It’s up on the wall.
Let’s take a look... We-ell...
That’s why there are so few people here. That’s the sanitation floor!
We used to call it the laundry. There are lots of mechanisms and washing machines, special disinfectants, but just a few people.
Let’s say this is my prize!
Oh, I can see a fire escape on the plan, too. It’s on the other end of the floor.

Just look at us! We’re like a real team!

So, dear audience, if you’ve just joined us, let me remind you that I, Martin Shepard, am with you today!
The most reckless neuroscientist ever, the conqueror of gravity and a first-class acrobat, the savior of humanity and soon-to-be a zombie!
Please, butt out your cigarettes and buckle up!
Let's get the party started!
And this party will be so crazy that... Oops...
WHAT THE FFF... IS THIS?!!
Hey, over! I've got somewhat of an emergency situation here!
Would you like to know what happened?
Oh, no big deal, I didn’t want to anyway.
I wouldn’t wish being in my shoes upon anyone alive!
Well, except the director of the new “Star Wars”, our pop-music celebrities and spammers.
No one but them. I'm good-hearted, actually. Very kind and good-hearted. So, kind that when I hear a shout “Let’s get it over with” I never answer “With whom?”
Okay, let's do it!
I’ll go to examine the A8 level.
Fear me, brain-suckers!
That's it, you’ve conquered my heart!
We have such an idyllic setup! We’re the best partners ever!
And also... it seems that my edginess sent me into a fit of talkativeness.
Perhaps, I better shut up and go searching for a path to salvation.
Level A8, I’m coming!
Yes, I want to know that too!
I don’t get any of it yet!
I guess I’ll have to...
At least maybe you could explain it to me.
I personally have no idea what this means!
Keep on moving.
Look around.
I’ve just caught on something with my shoes... and it tinkled.
I highlighted the floor with my flashlight. And this is...
These are cartridge empties!
DO YOU UNDERSTAND??!
Where did they come from?
Who was shooting our zombies?
We were told that even the guards only had electric batons.
We called them powerhouses because of these batons...
Shit! Goosebumps down my spine!
I can’t figure out whether that's because of my bad feeling or because of the hope?
Use your eyes!
That’s not funny.
I see drag marks on the tile floor – brown blood trails.
Seems like there was a very neat zombie killer here.
Well, that’s what I say!
If the floor is still dirty, then we aren’t dealing with some janitor zombie-killer.
It was almost certainly a guard. What do you think about my deductive skills?
Move along.
What else is there?
Well... That's right approach.
Well, I’m in a wide corridor now; it leads to the utility rooms.
Lamps are switched off, it's very quiet, and my voice is booming. There's even a tiny echo.
On the wall... Yes, I can see the bullet holes on the wall.
And trails of blood.
Whoever was shooting here, they shot a lot.
There was a real battle in here. But... I don’t see any dead bodies.
That’s weird, isn't it?
No... Nothing special.
Well. Of course, if I were Sherlock Holmes, I would puff the pipe and say something.
Something smart, like “Elementary, my dear Watson! They were shooting zombies here!”
What do you think?
Listen, it turned out that I have plenty of talents. Apparently, one of them is being Captain Obvious.
But I’ve got a lot more to learn about deduction...
Well, maybe I'll be able to see something else up ahead there.
I’m starting to move further into the floor.
Okay, okay...
Do you think your jokes are any better?
Better? Well, congratulations, I'm proud of you.
And I’m sprinkling ashes on my head and moving on to explore.
Moving on offended, keep that in mind.
What's up?
Calm down!
Well, I've got a slight hitch.
A hitch of the unpleasant kind.
Or of the very unpleasant kind.
Or... it's just... you know...
It’s very bad!
Speak out!
The explosion caused a crash here in the corridor.
Panels, lamps and pieces of concrete tumbled from the ceiling.
Maybe that’s why THAT man, the murderer with a gun, didn’t notice one more body.
Otherwise he would remove it for sure.
D'you wanna know why I emphasized the words FOR SURE?
Calm down?
Maybe you’re right, the-man-who-is-safe-and-does-not-wander-along-zombie-infested-dark-corridors.
But as soon as I tell you what’s going on, you'll lose your head, too.
What, are you overwhelmed, too?
Did your intuition work? Do you understand what I ran into?
We have to put up with it... Because...
Who's she?
Take a breath.
There's a human body here!
I mean A HUMAN body! A human, not a zombie!
Do you understand?
A murder took place here!
I see neither bite marks nor irreversible changes left by the virus on this poor woman’s body!
She... She was just murdered!
Keep on moving.
I don't know...
This poor woman is not from the educated clan. She has no white coat on her, only a lab outfit.
She may have been one of the tech assistants.
Well, you know, she may have washed the lab coats and disinfected test tubes.
One of the ones you never noticed, while their job is done well.
We called them the good elves. Because they always gave us clean clothes.
And now... Oh God.
She has got nothing on her. No documents. But I can safely state that her death is the result of a gunshot wound to the chest cavity.
I'm stressing: there are no signs of infection on the body.
It just doesn’t make any sense! Why would she be killed?
Just a second... right you are.
I need to calm down...
I... I wasn’t ready for this.
I thought there was a biological collapse right here, a viral accident, but...
A murder! Oh, my God! Who’d do this?
OK, just a minute. I pulled myself together.
Now I need to turn to the body and inspect it more closely.
To the laundry.
To the infection isolation ward.
Well, I’ll keep on moving.
Now I have to move very quietly.
I don’t want to share this poor woman’s fate.
Provided that the shooter is still alive.
Well... this is the end of the corridor.
Oh, my heart is in my mouth. This place smells horrendous.
The waste-pipe in the kitchen sink seems faulty.
The waste is not being removed, to add to the smell of blood and decomposition.
Can you imagine this? I’m moving through it, I can almost touch this smell.
That’s awful, here’s where you start appreciating nature and open air...
Hey, Comandante, I've reached the end of the corridor.
There are three doors here. There’s a plaque on one of them: “Hazardous materials. Delta pass holders only.”
Though there’s no electricity here, the door is still locked.
But I don’t have this level of access. I'm just a neuroscientist.
Now I’ve only got two doors to choose from. There's a steel door and a wooden one.
The wooden door with a “Laundry room” plaque. And the steel one reads “Infection isolation ward. Attention! Hazmat suit required for entrance!”
Where do you think I should go?
Yeah, that’s a puzzle.
That's a bad puzzle...
What's there?!
Any good news?
Maybe you've got some good news.
That makes sense, I need to search the laundry first.
Your decisions are always so reasonable.
Logic is your middle name.
Well, I’ll shut up and move on to the laundry.
My Goodness, these doors have such a dreadful creak.
OK, I'm in.
It’s dark, damp and smells nasty. Anyway, everything is nasty here now.
I’ll keep on moving.
Listen, I can see the bullet holes and empties again.
I'm in some nightmare!
Oh, that looks promising.
Well, go to the laundry.
Come in!
Hmm... Are you completely sure of this?
I mean are you a hundred percent sure?
Because they require some sort of a suit here.
Go, go, go!
Alright, go to the laundry.
My death will be on your conscience, pal.
If I catch some virus... in addition to the one that I already have...
I’ll be coming to you in your dreams and sighing sadly.
And I'll also be staring reproachfully. I’m good at that
Actually, I’m staring reproachfully at my transmitter right now.
Stop arguing!
Rush to the laundry!
You’re so stubborn, aren't you?
The height of stubbornness is to keep typing the wrong password until the computer accepts it... That’s what you’re like, right?
Okay, that's it. It's your decision. I’m going into the infection isolation ward.
Though I'm so unsecure without a suit.
Accepted, and I won’t change it.
Forget it: go to the laundry.
You could stand your ground forever, couldn’t you?

“Report by Kirk Rickson, Senior Lieutenant of the special forces company for protection of top-secret federal facilities.”
“The report is prepared in case I will be unable to wait for a support or a clean-up unit”
“After the emergency, which I qualify as a terrorist attack, the biological environment suffered a crisis.”
“The warfare virus has spread all over the facility, striking almost all the staff members.”
“The exact routes of exposure are unknown. Assumption: Major Jackson may know something about it.”

“This assumption follows from his order to destroy all of the egghead traitors!”

“Be advised: the order to clear the territory of the living and the dead, both infected and uninfected, was carried out.”
“Level A8 is free of these traitors!”
“Yet after the aggressive infection surged, the damn nerds went mad and killed all our fighters.”
“I tend to think that I'm the last one standing. At least there were no more signals from our men. The dedicated channel is dead”.
“We know that the scientists who were developing the viral weaponry infected “Shelter M-2” intentionally.”
“Detailed information on this incident is stored in the portable computer of our commander Major Jackson”.
“Minutes before the connection with the Major and his group was lost, he was on the A-4 level.

“I was almost out of ammo when strange activity commenced on level A8.”
“I noticed non-human presence, I heard a call for murders.”
“Strange creatures appear on the floor about once every few hours. They call themselves the Abyss residents...”
“I know how it sounds. And you may call me crazy. But I'm in my right mind.”
“Moreover, I can evaluate the situation critically...”
“After the first clashes with the Abyss residents, which resembled hell itself, I started shooting to kill.”

“Since then, I've become a believer... But I won’t abandon my post!”
“My ammo is almost gone, but I will perform my duty till the end.”
