I don’t want them to go through this hell and to feel everything that I’m feeling right now...
But... a-a-a... it’s so painful... I can’t move a finger...
I’d love to... Death is asking the same thing... But all these people above us...
But my family...
If I give up, they'll go through all that I’m going right now...
But I can’t move a finger. This pain is excruciating...
Use the explosives.
You've got pills.
If I had any pain killers...
I’d have one single chance then...
But all that I have is the bag with freakin’ explosives!
Are you sure?
I'm not sure!
Are you sure it’s gonna work?
I’m on the lower level. The generators are higher up.
And they are protected. An explosion here may not stop them...
Pills?.. Wait! Right you are!
I had a blister with two painkiller pills!
Let me look for it now!
Okay... okay...
In the end I knew that the moment would come.
I’m setting the timer for 10 seconds.
So I won’t have any time to change my mind...
Done, pal. And now...
FAREWELL! And thank you for everything...
[The explosion dampened Shepard’s moaning and there was only the crackling sound on the air]
[SIGNAL IS LOST]
[But it took you only two weeks to understand: the generators were intact]
[Because in two weeks IT BEGAN]
And I'm not sure... Wait!
I had a blister with two painkiller pills!
Let me search for it now!
What comes next?
Here they are! They are right here! Oh God, thank you!
I’m not sure that they’re gonna help, but they should be at least somewhat useful!
Right, one minute, I’ll try to chew them...
Bitter... damn... Either the pills worked or the bout has gone but...
I’ve got some energy now...
I... stood up, with an effort, but still.
My legs are shaking but I’m standing up!
Yes, just great...
I’m about to dance with joy.
Did you ask me this question now?
Damned if I know...
That’s absurd!
I... I forgot to tell you about something.
When I was... OUTSIDE my body I saw...
Shit, I feel like crap! And the words aren’t coming out right.
Not just “saw”, but it’s as if someone slipped this knowledge into my head.
Who? What?! Why? Where from? How?
I don’t know how, but I suddenly realized that you can only exit this level through the elevators and the stairs.
And the elevators aren’t working. Soldiers shut them down when the zombies had destroyed their bomb squad.
Don’t ask me how I know that, okay? The answer is always the same.
We won’t be able to use the stairs for the same reason.
So we only have one option...
Let's think it over.
Let's get into the tunnel.
Something... that I still can’t name, somehow let me know another way to the generator room.
It’s the central ventilation shaft. It’s right above us.
It’s a big tube over a man’s height in diameter. It spirals around the whole A2 level, and then the tunnel splits.
It branches out into a lot of small channels and tunnels. Like we used to see them.
So, the central tunnel will lead me to the main air-intake pump.
Two supporting pumps are right nearby. Luckily for us, they are all in the same place.
If I manage to get there I’ll able to blow them up with the explosives.
And then we won’t need to worry about the generators. Air-inlet pumps won’t open up the way to the surface for the virus.
All this filth’s going to stay right here. And the soldiers will burn it all down.
Though... I’m not sure, but it seems that SOMETHING, which has given me knowledge, doesn’t want to die from the napalm.
But we don’t care, right? The most important thing are the people above us.
We only have one problem — time.
The central ventilation shaft is very long. It spans about a kilometer.
I’m not sure that I could get through it and drag the explosives with me...
So what? Have you got any ideas? Or should we get into the tunnel first?
Maybe. But I’m not in the position to argue.
Not even in the position to verify my knowledge.
Holy hell, all of my life is now pure nonsense! One clap — and there's no neuroscientist named Shepard anymore!
That's it! That's the end of my existence...
Basically, we've only got one option.
Well... Easy. Let's think...
Hmm... No idea so far...
Meanwhile, time is running out.
Let me look for something that would hook the tunnel’s grated hatch. So we don't waste our time.
Wait a minute, okay?
I won’t switch off so as not to waste any energy.. Just wandering around and searching.
I’m searching and there are colored circles swimming before my eyes.
The pain grew duller, but it’s like a monster cornered in the basement by the sun rays: it’s ready to return when the night falls.
And that night will last forever... Eternal gloom of the Abyss into which I peeked for a moment...
Oh, this bar looks perfect to me. What would you say?
A flat steel bar. I guess repairmen and builders use this stuff — devil knows.
Something between a ruler and... and just an iron ruler. But a thick one.
I’ll try to get to the hatch and hook the cover...
Wait a minute...
I'm still trying...
Damn! The world is going dark right before my eyes... It came off!
Once again... Yes. I did it! I unlocked the hatch!!!
OK. I'll look for something that would hook the tunnel’s grated hatch.
Wait a minute, okay?
I won’t switch off so as not to waste any energy.. Just wandering around and searching.
I’m searching and there are colored circles swimming before my eyes.
The pain grew duller, but it’s like a monster cornered in the basement by the sun rays: it’s ready to return when the night falls.
And that night will last forever... Eternal gloom of the Abyss into which I peeked for a moment...
Oh, this bar looks perfect for me. What would you say?
A flat steel bar. I guess repairmen and builders use this stuff — devil knows.
Something between a ruler and... and just an iron ruler. But a thick one.
I’ll try to get to the hatch and hook the cover...
Wait a minute...
I'm still trying...
Damn! The world is going dark right before my eyes... It came off!
Once again... Yes. I did it! I unlocked the hatch!!!
It... it took a huge effort, but I got into the tunnel...
And now I feel like I'm almost there. I'm on the verge.
And we have to decide how I...
Damn! This damn smell is distracting me!
Smells delicious! Where is this smell coming from?
It's meat... it just seems so scrumptious... I can’t think of anything but this smell!
FILLET! Defrosted fillet right in my bag!
I’m ready to gobble it up...
Wait! I've got an idea! I know how to get to the pumps!
Have you ever been to a racetrack?
I haven’t either, anyway, it doesn’t matter!
I’ll explain everything to you now!
Oh, lucky you! I’ve never been to one. Anyway, it doesn’t matter!
I’ll explain everything to you now! You’ll get it.
Actually I have some doubts.
Why didn’t it cross my mind earlier! I'm a neuroscientist after all!
I must know everything about instincts and reflexes! Damn...
The virus is misleading me. My mouth is watering when I think about meat...
Well, coming back to dog racing! These dogs aren’t just hightailing to the finish line!
The dogs couldn’t care less for racing!
A mechanical rabbit is launched along special rails parallel to the race track to make the dogs run to the finish line.
It’s bait that’s always a step ahead of the hounds!
And their hunting instinct makes them chase that hare. Whoever has better instincts and is physically stronger wins.
But enough about racing, let’s get back to me.
On that level I’ll move in a spiral inside the tunnel. And it leads to an exit on the technical floor, right by the pumps. This means that it’s a direct route!
I’ll tie a piece of meat to one end of the metal stick that I found below and I’ll attach the other end to my backpack straps.
There are explosives and a timer in the backpack. This way they will be behind my back and... I won’t see them when I turn into a zombie.
Thus, I will remember nothing. I’ll only focus on the piece of meat hanging in front of my face!
I won’t be able to reach it with my hands! And as a result...
So I’ll be walking straight ahead! Right to the pumps. Let me be a zombie, it won’t stop me!
You're exaggerating, but... thanks!
I want you to know that you are the best assistant ever!
Of course, there are some nuances, but we have no choice.
My pain is coming back. And this will be the last spell.
Basically, we've only got one chance.
I do not relish the idea that the neuroscientist who dreamt of the greatest discoveries in science will be a kind of Pavlov’s dog.
It’s not how I imagined the end of my career. I don’t want to be led by instinct alone and drool over a piece of raw meat that isn’t too fresh.
What do you think? I wouldn't wish this on my worst enemy.
They say that God’s ways are inscrutable...
Well, I’ll get to build my wonderful invention and you should do one thing for me. Deal?
I can’t remember, what’s the average speed of a pedestrian?
Three kilometers per hour? Or five kilometers?
Just google it, okay? I need to know what time to set the timer for.
If the bomb explodes before time, our entire plan will be ruined.
Well, come on, I’m counting on you.
Hey, pal, I'm ready. And what about you? Did you find the information?
Is it five or three kilometers per hour?
Good luck!
I'm so sorry...
Are you sure? Five? Hope you checked everything.
There's no one else I can trust.
Okay, I'm making calculations and setting the timer...
My head is swirling badly and I’m drooling all over...
That's it! The timer is set and ticking rhythmically inside the backpack!
It’s bloodcurdling... I'm terribly scared...
“I’m on a Highway to Hell,” as AC/DC once sung...
Well, buddy, I'm ready.
Got it, pal, whatever you say.
I can trust you.
[But the explosion proved the opposite...]
[The calculations were wrong]
[The air intake system and backup generators remained intact]
[In two weeks they started pushing out clouds of the virus up to the ground surface]
[The Apocalyptic Plague came to our world]
A questionable wish for someone who is going into Death’s chambers.
But I remember our mission. For now.
That’s why... I accept your wish, pal.
I know... I’m also sorry that I forced you into this whole mess.
You’re a good man, and good men should live a peaceful life.
You did a good deed. And more than once.
You helped me. You are saving lots of people.
So... c’est la vie.
And a different world hasn’t been invented for us yet, has it?
Hey! How are you?
Talk to me.
I’m moving forward...
The timer is ticking in the back. “tick-tock, tick-tock”. Death seems to be humming its song impatiently right behind me.
Tick-tock. Tick-tock.
The pain is back... my heart’s beating heavily and slowly...
It’s very dark and quiet here in the tunnel...
I can’t see anything, I can only hear my own breath and shuffling steps.
I grew completely weak... And this smell...
My sensitivity to odors increased... I can sense this alluring smell of raw meat and blood...
I’m hyper-salivating... Fever... Muscle spasms...
I'm going straight ahead... That’s strange, I’m trying to remember my family...
But there’s only that abyss, the one I've looked into before.
It was so peaceful there, there's no pain...
What’s this bag on my back? It’s heavy... and it’s burning my back for some reason...
As if there’s some danger inside it... I can't think straight...
I can’t concentrate... only this smell...
Have to move on, towards the meat...
It’s so delicious... juicy... raw... keep moving... to kill...
Hah?.. Arhg-m... Voice?
Is that you, buddy?!
I remember something...
But who are you?..
What are you doing in my head?
A-a-a... argh... Talk to me...
I won’t keep silent... I...
Who am I?.. Where am I... Oh!
But the meat... it smells so...
Good... what’s this ticking? How can I get to the meat?!
Food... Blood.
There’s a nice sound to the word “blood”... Sound... But more like “blaarghd”.
[No matter how hard you tried, Shepard didn’t react anymore]
[For a long time all you heard was the dull growling and shuffling steps]
[The one who once used to be Shepard, a neuroscientist, who sacrificed himself for other people and for you — has gone]
[He had sunk into oblivion]
[But his physical shell continued to carry out the last will of his mind]
[The shuffling, drooling zombie was going towards his target — slowly, but unfailingly]
[Now the faded spark of the human mind was still making this biological organism move]
[And when it has reached the target and the time was over, you heard a brief explosion]
[It’s blown everything away]
[But the main thing was that this explosion saved humanity]
[Fateful words appeared on your transmitter’s screen]
[SIGNAL IS LOST]
[You didn't wait for it. You knew that the search won’t bring any results]
[Everything was over]
[For a brief moment you felt that Shepard was near]
[He smiled, nodded with a feeling of a duty fulfilled and then disappeared]
[You couldn’t tell whether it was a hallucination or something more]
[The story was already over, anyway]
[Well, it was not the worst ending]
[People can sleep peacefully]
No... I’m definitely not all right...
...Oh, God... You sure about that?
If it’s a virus, then...
You’ve got a piece of meat!
Get up, quicker!
Turns out that I was seriously wrong in my assumptions.
I've got even less time left than I presumed.
Transformation has accelerated! Damn-damn-damn!
I’m too young to die... and to become... THIS!
We were probably wrong when we decided to go search for the data first instead of heading to the generators...
There's a good chance that I’ll be late... You know what I'm talking about...
My stomach’s growling! I guess even you can hear that.
Have I got WHAT?!
I don’t get it, are you suggesting that I eat a piece of defrosted meat?!
A piece of RAW meat?!
You... Are you putting me on?
I’m not a zombie yet! It’s grossing me out!
No, I better be quick!
No, I’m not going to bicker! You’re certainly right!
Are you OK?
What's up?
I'm coming upstairs. Oh boy!
It appears kind of challenging in my condition. And all this wreckage... And...
What the hell is this?!!
I... Yes, I’m fine! But that sound...
What is it? Where is it coming from?
It scared me terribly! So abrupt!
What the hell! It was just the military radio!
My transmitter picked up a signal! I'm passing over the receiver.
I’m hearing some shrill sound... It's hissing and clacking!
What the hell?! It’s so loud! Where is it coming from?!
It scared me terribly! Ah, crap!
It was just the military radio! It picked up a signal!
I'm passing over the receiver.
Where are you now?
Is everything OK?
“Delta squad, over! Delta, over!”
“Demolition crew, where the hell are you?!”
“Delta squad, over! Respond!”
“Delta squad speaking! Hear you loud and clear, captain!”
“Sam! You wanna get court martialed? Why the hell were you out of reach for so long?”
“All okay, cap, we were executing your order. The stairway is rigged with explosives now”
Are you sure? Is everything OK? Have you seen any of the infected? Any encounters? Report!”
“There's not a single white-coat bastard, cap... Everything’s A-OK.”
“Glad to hear. We shot dozens of them on the A0 level! Tough rascals, nine-lived!”
“Our sector is clear, cap. We’re in between A4 and... What the hell?!
“Delta, over! What’s going on?”
Where did so many of them come from?! Who called the elevator?! Did they all come out of it?! Fuck! Come on! Shoot!”
“Delta, over! Respond! Delta, over! Sam!”
“I repeat, Delta, respond now! Why are you holding your fire? Report, Goddammit!”
“Wait, guys! We’re coming! Hold on!”
That's it... Transmission failed. Fuck!
What the hell is going on here?!
Go to A4.
Isn't there another way?
I’m still on the staircase and, according to the soldiers, they should be somewhere one and a half level above me.
There’s no shooting anymore. I can assume that the zombies have done away with them.
For sure, it’s horrible, too horrible, but...
It’s even more horrible that a much bigger squad is about to arrive here and then that's the end for me.
It’s only half a flight up to the A4 level. I think I’ll get there before the soldiers.
Or I should go to the level where the shooting sounded?
It’s all quiet around here. Though I heard some sounds in the distance.
As if somebody was shooting and screaming even louder.
Maybe you've got some good news?
What do you see?
I’m in front of the door to the A4 level fire escape!
It’s locked, no wonder. As you know, that’s not a problem for me at all.
So, I’m taking out the keys, trying carefully not to jingle them. I’m opening...
Did it! I'm in. I’m closing the door and locking it.
That's it! I’m safe... holy crappy-crap!!!
There's no other way. Sorry for disappointing you.
We either go up to the soldiers or to the A4 level, as we had initially decided.
You know perfectly well that going to the soldiers without a good reason is suicidal.
So I’ll try to steal past them undetected and go to the director’s level, right?
I see... see a nightmare... t-transformed into reality...
Good news? Well, if you’re the director of “House of 1000 Corpses”, then yes, I have some good news.
Are you sure they’re all dead?
Go, don’t waste your time.
There’s electricity on this level. Some lamps are buzzing, others are wrecked by bullets...
They’re throwing blue sparks, their crackling is getting on my nerves...
The fact that there’s electricity here explains why all the elevators work. It’s the soldiers' handiwork. And I helped them when I turned off the freezers...
They’re hooking up each level, step by step... There must be something that they need here.
And what’s more... There was a real battle here!
This corridor used to be covered with wood paneling and the floor — with granite-like tile.
Now all the walls and floors are riddled with bullets and explosions. I can’t see the floor — it’s covered in garbage, bullet cases and blast debris.
There are lots of bodies in the corridor... I can see the ex-zombies (that’s obvious from the striking changes after the transformation).
Guards are here too. They definitely tried to hinder the zombies’ advance. But now... now they are resting at the edge of eternity.
There’s another type among the dead — the survivors! I mean... yes, I just realized what I’d said. The dead are the survivors...
You got it, didn’t you? Those who were uninfected were killed here, too. They were killed by the guards, not by zombies!
There are bullet holes in their bodies. A real crime was perpetrated here — a mass execution.
Oh, how I wish I could get my hands on the one who gave this order!
That was a real maniac! Damn...
That means that the director's office must be here somewhere. With the info about “Serum-22” in it. By the way...
...there must also be Major Jackson’s laptop with the information about the beginning of the epidemic.
I need to get through this corridor of death in order to find all these things. What would you say?
Well, go.
No, wait.
I’d also like to know that. If some of the zombies or guards are still alive... It’ll be very hard to escape from them.
But the corridor is long, so I’m not sure that it’s safe.
Do you get it? I'll have to take this risk.
Come on.
You better keep silent.
I’m starting to move. I’ll move as slowly and quietly as possible.
Hmm... You know, I have a disturbing thought. Would you like me to say it out loud?
I’d like to stand here and talk a little, drink a cup of tea.
But you forgot about a small nuance — the virus in my blood
And we still need to turn off the generators on the technical floor, you know.
We’re not just out of time, we’re living on credit, don’t you see?
I have to go.
How can it be?
My idea is this: where did all the zombies on the director’s floor come from?
Sure, there was a lot of staff here. But not THIS MUCH...
Seems like they came here from all over the entire lab. Do you see?
Seems like someone drove zombies here on purpose, by sending them to fight with the guards.
Easy. Whatever you say...
It's probably for the best. Why on earth should I worry about this sort of questions?
Silence is golden, as we all know. Isn’t that right?
Except that I can’t keep silent when I’m nervous...
Keep going.
Do you see anything weird?
I passed a quarter of the corridor. And moved beyond the first bodies.
They show no signs of life. That’s fine, actually.
I wish I could find an emergency map of this level. You know, like those the ones that hang on the walls in case of fire evacuation.
Then I’d know where to go at once. But I can’t see any map here.
I have no idea, but I’ve got the same exact feeling.
Like someone or something was trying to stop the guards.
That’s weird... Okay, there are no answers yet. May be “yet” isn’t the right word, but “at all” would fit.
I’ll keep on moving.
Maybe. Your reaction is that of a normal person.
I guess, I got infected by the atmosphere of this place.
Оh! I got it now: the two of us are like a classical soap couple!
You’re always analyzing everything critically and skeptically, and I’m this really heroic neuroscientist!
Well, I’m rambling a lot again. I’m still moving.
Yes, right. I have to make an effort, but I’m moving ahead.
It’s pretty terrifying here...
You know, it seems to me that we understand the word “weird” a bit differently.
Have you ever mused over this?
The whole situation would seem weird to me before. But now...
I bet you wanted to ask me whether I saw something threatening.
My answer would be something like “No, pal. The coast is clear”. I mean there’s no danger yet.
This “yet” is the most unpredictable word ever.
Go to the director.
Start searching.
I've cut through a half of the corridor already. I'm walking like a death angel on the battlefield.
There are only corpses around me. There's a heavy odor, shimmering light and the troubling hum of the electricity.
If I recall correctly, the director’s office should be somewhere near the conference hall in the end of the corridor.
I'm passing by some offices. Almost all the doors are closed.
I mean - closed, not locked. I haven’t tried to break in yet.
Should I try or is it best to just keep going right to the director’s office?
What's going on there?
Are you okay?
OK. Let's start with the most important things.
I’m walking along the corridor. It's also quiet here.
I could say it’s a dead repose unless I wasn’t staring at all these miserable...
I'm going to the director’s room. Here we are! That's his door.
There’s a plaque on it: “Howard Bloomberg. Executive director”.
Yeah, Howard Bloomberg was also the best executive, no match for all these pen pushers and bribe-takers so common in the scientific field.
Could you ever imagine that in a place like this, where such great scientists (I don’t mean myself) gathered, something like this would happen...
Oh my...
Well, I'm coming in.
Oh, damn it!
Yeah, nice.
Being afraid of staplers is quite normal.
Okay, I’m starting... I'm coming inside the first random office.
I can see a cabinet and a table. I’ll check inside the cabinet first.
I’m getting used to rummaging through strangers’ cabinets, sometimes it’s kind of useful.
It’s surprising how quickly people can change and adapt to new circumstances.
There’s nothing but a clean white lab coat in it.
Should I put it on? What do you think?
Never mind. I know it will only be in the way.
I'm coming to the table and looking into the drawers. There is a pile of papers and a deadly weapon called a stapler.
I hurt myself with this thing once. I've been afraid to handle it ever since.
Yep, no need to giggle, you’re talking to the first stapler-phobiac on Earth.
You may think it’s nothing serious, but as soon as you take a stapler, it sends a staple deep inside your finger!
You need to understand: every man has his weak side. I’m afraid of staplers. They are evil.
They’re like a mini-weapon of Inquisition. If Torquemada had one, he would staple all the heretics, I’m sure about that.
I guess, there’s even a place in hell where staplers, instead of demons, torment sinners.
You think it’s weird, don’t you?
Phew, you’re so boring.
You are not afraid of staplers and think that makes you special, right?
Well, you can be proud of yourself, you’re cool — on a first-name basis with staplers.
But I'm a neuroscientist, not a technician, I'm used to working with my head, not with my hands.
Why are you clinging on to me anyway? I’m pouring out my soul to you, but you...
You were too quick to agree, that’s suspicious. Are you mocking me?
No? Well, in that case - thanks. I'm so lucky to have you.
We could confide in each other over a cup of tea someday, I’m sure of it.
Of course, you have the vibe of a cool guy with no fears or doubts, but you’ve got to be afraid of some little things like staplers, too.
It’ll bring us closer to each other.
Let’s talk about it later.
Keep on searching.
Go to the director.
All right, I’m done with the searching.
There's nothing in this room. Absolutely nothing.
What should I do next? Should I search the remaining rooms or go to the director's?
Well, I'll go in... I went out into the corridor.
Man, what's this? There’s blood on the office doorknob.
That seems like some sort of a sign to me, you know...
I’ll try to go in first...
It makes sense: if you start something, you need to finish it.
I went out into the corridor... Hmm... There are so many offices here... Man! What do we have here?
Listen, there’s blood on the office doorknob.
That seems like some sort of a sign to me. I’ll search this office, okay?
Be careful!
Approach him.
I'm coming in! I think it’s the blood of one of the survivors of the fight.
He was trying to escape and... Fuck!
I can see him! It's a guard.
There's no point in that. He's dead.
I got it, will do. Besides, he can’t hurt me anyway. Poor guy is dead like the Moon’s surface.
Are you sure?
Turn on the laptop.
He must have gotten a good beating in that fight. I can see bite marks on his arms and neck. More than three.
There’s no reason to beware of this guard. He knew what his future would be like, so he killed himself.
It looks terrible, but I'm getting used to the violence.
Let me see what he’s got...
There's an army laptop in the corner! It... it’s the major’s, the one that we were looking for!
I’m not sure, but there’s only one way to be certain of that. Isn’t that right?
I have to turn on his laptop.
You’re right, I’m about to do this.
How intriguing.
Watch his videos.
I got lucky. It’s already turned on and isn't password-protected.
It’s like a suicide note. As if... Okay, let’s see what we have on this laptop.
Hmm... There’s a report. Let me activate this audio file.
“...The squad is destroyed... I’m all alone... the division bio-signals are lost... they’re all dead...”
“It’s my turn now... It’s my own decision. It's better to blow my brains out than become... one of these suckers!”
“Well... gather your wits, Major...”
“I haven’t got enough time to prepare a detailed report. But on the... ahem... ahem... all files from the security system are stored on my computer...”
“They support our first hypothesis: this biological disaster was set off in the lab intentionally...”
“This catastrophe was perpetrated by one of the lab staff members. That’s... that’s all so weird!”
“I don’t have the strength to structure and analyze the information adequately!”
“I understand that none of those resident scientists had an opportunity to trigger the infection”
“They needed to have different clearance levels for different rooms, keys from the guard post, passwords to all these virus boxes...”
“Even a group of scientists just couldn’t do anything, all system was set up to prevent that!”
“It’s all guarded like the President’s nuclear briefcase! But...”
“The fact remains... The video shows that there was ONLY ONE PERSON who released the virus. That’s an absolute mystery to me...”
“How did he find out all the secret information?! Even we don’t have all keys!”
“They change every 12 hours, and passwords as well...”
“This could be done by one man only with the support of President himself or the Presidential Adviser, but this version is absurd!”
“That means... that means that we have a complete mystery here...”
“And... also... my squad was ordered to annihilate everything and everyone as per code red, but...”
“There’s another odd thing... we were attacked by zombies!”
“We’d cleared up the entire level from the enemies, but... somehow they just appeared out of nowhere and...”

Well, I’m done! The results are meager, but we should still be happy, right?
First of all, I found the latest samples of uninfected tissues...
Okay, simply put, I pinched two frozen chicken breasts from the fridge.
Perhaps we’ll need them later. In 36 hours, I’ll feel starved enough not to mind hordes of zombies around.
So we shouldn’t neglect our physical bodies, right?
And secondly, we now have a pack of painkillers. I already took one.
Soon the pain from the bite should subside, and I’ll finally be able to generate sensible ideas.
Or it would turn out I’m only alive because of you.
No offence, I really appreciate it, but it’s kind of embarrassing.
Anyway, feelings aside, I’ve got something else. Wanna hear?
So, I peeked into the lab log while I was searching the room.
Just the usual lab notes: tissue samples, list of animals, their reactions to the virus.
Yeah, nothing special.
All these notes are labeled with an “A”, which means that the virus was active.
That is, the virus affects humans, animals and birds with equal success.
Although it acts in different ways.
Only humans are turned into zombies because of their well-developed central nervous system and the ability to think.
Well... It says here that some birds simply die from the virus, and the rest become carriers, like plague-stricken rats in the Middle Ages.
It’s not the entire paperwork. You see, it only contains registration of incoming samples labeled with an “A”. So, I can’t tell you every detail.
I heard that the virus affects cold-blooded animals and mammals differently.
But that's not the issue! Here’s what caught my attention. I quote:
“Serum-22 trials conducted outside the main group succeeded once again.”
“Detailed information containing computations, plots and dosages was sent to Mr. Bloomberg.”
“After that, we received an order to cease all experiments with Serum-22 on our floor.”
That's it. Bloomberg is our chief executive.
His office is on the A4 level... And it looks like that’s where we have to look for the rest of the information.
Okay, I'll search through it now.
I'll need a couple of minutes for this, deal?
I'll get in touch with you as soon as I’m done.
